1.Text:
See the Data Structure Intro section.Creating a Series by passing a list of values, letting pandas create
a default integer index:
1.Code_snippet:
In [5]: dates = pd.date_range('20130101', periods=6)

In [6]: dates
Out[6]: 
DatetimeIndex(['2013-01-01', '2013-01-02', '2013-01-03', '2013-01-04',
               '2013-01-05', '2013-01-06'],
              dtype='datetime64[ns]', freq='D')

In [7]: df = pd.DataFrame(np.random.randn(6, 4), index=dates, columns=list('ABCD'))

In [8]: df
Out[8]: 
                   A         B         C         D
2013-01-01  0.469112 -0.282863 -1.509059 -1.135632

Title: Object Creation

2.Text:
Creating a DataFrame by passing a NumPy array, with a datetime index
and labeled columns:
2.Code_snippet:
In [9]: df2 = pd.DataFrame({'A': 1.,
   ...:                     'B': pd.Timestamp('20130102'),
   ...:                     'C': pd.Series(1, index=list(range(4)), dtype='float32'),
   ...:                     'D': np.array([3] * 4, dtype='int32'),
   ...:                     'E': pd.Categorical(["test", "train", "test", "train"]),
   ...:                     'F': 'foo'})
   ...: 

In [10]: df2
Out[10]: 
     A          B    C  D      E    F
0  1.0 2013-01-02  1.0  3   test  foo
1  1.0 2013-01-02  1.0  3  train  foo
2  1.0 2013-01-02  1.0  3   test  foo
3  1.0 2013-01-02  1.0  3  train  foo
Title: Object Creation

27.Text:
NoteWhile standard Python / Numpy expressions for selecting and setting are
intuitive and come in handy for interactive work, for production code, we
recommend the optimized pandas data access methods, .at, .iat,
.loc and .iloc.See the indexing documentation Indexing and Selecting Data and MultiIndex / Advanced Indexing.Selecting a single column, which yields a Series,
equivalent to df.A:
27.Code_snippet:
In [38]: df.iat[1, 1]
Out[38]: -0.17321464905330858
Title: Selection

28.Text: Selecting via [], which slices the rows.
28.Code_snippet:

2013-01-04  0.721555 -0.706771 -1.039575  0.271860
Title: Selection

105.Text:
NoteWhile standard Python / Numpy expressions for selecting and setting are
intuitive and come in handy for interactive work, for production code, we
recommend the optimized pandas data access methods, .at, .iat,
.loc and .iloc.See the indexing documentation Indexing and Selecting Data and MultiIndex / Advanced Indexing.Selecting a single column, which yields a Series,
equivalent to df.A:
105.Code_snippet:
In [38]: df.iat[1, 1]
Out[38]: -0.17321464905330858
Title: Selection

183.Text:
NoteWhile standard Python / Numpy expressions for selecting and setting are
intuitive and come in handy for interactive work, for production code, we
recommend the optimized pandas data access methods, .at, .iat,
.loc and .iloc.See the indexing documentation Indexing and Selecting Data and MultiIndex / Advanced Indexing.Selecting a single column, which yields a Series,
equivalent to df.A:
183.Code_snippet:
In [38]: df.iat[1, 1]
Out[38]: -0.17321464905330858
Title: Selection

261.Text:
NoteWhile standard Python / Numpy expressions for selecting and setting are
intuitive and come in handy for interactive work, for production code, we
recommend the optimized pandas data access methods, .at, .iat,
.loc and .iloc.See the indexing documentation Indexing and Selecting Data and MultiIndex / Advanced Indexing.Selecting a single column, which yields a Series,
equivalent to df.A:
261.Code_snippet:
In [38]: df.iat[1, 1]
Out[38]: -0.17321464905330858
Title: Selection

339.Text:

intuitive and come in handy for interactive work, for production code, we
recommend the optimized pandas data access methods, .at, .iat,
.loc and .iloc.See the indexing documentation Indexing and Selecting Data and MultiIndex / Advanced Indexing.Selecting a single column, which yields a Series,
equivalent to df.A:
339.Code_snippet:

417.Text:
NoteWhile standard Python / Numpy expressions for selecting and setting are
intuitive and come in handy for interactive work, for production code, we
recommend the optimized pandas data access methods, .at, .iat,
.loc and .iloc.See the indexing documentation Indexing and Selecting Data and MultiIndex / Advanced Indexing.Selecting a single column, which yields a Series,
equivalent to df.A:
417.Code_snippet:

495.Text:
NoteWhile standard Python / Numpy expressions for selecting and setting are
intuitive and come in handy for interactive work, for production code, we
recommend the optimized pandas data access methods, .at, .iat,
.loc and .iloc.See the indexing documentation Indexing and Selecting Data and MultiIndex / Advanced Indexing.Selecting a single column, which yields a Series,
equivalent to df.A:
495.Code_snippet:
In [38]: df.iat[1, 1]
